means: 感到或引起腹或肠绞痛( gripe的过去式和过去分词 )
抱怨（某人[某事物]），发牢骚

sentence.Network_en: She gave some medicine to me when my stomach griped.
sentence.Network_cn: 我胃痛时她给了我一些药.

sentence.Network_en: Farmers have long griped about a dearth of competition.
sentence.Network_cn: 农民们早就为缺乏竞争而牢骚满腹.

sentence.Network_en: The man griped the woman's hands gravely, and looked at her a stern sight.
sentence.Network_cn: 男人严肃的握住女人的手, 眼神犀利的盯住她!

boat gong 信号锣boat gripe 艇系紧带boat gripe 稳艇带
gripe in 缚稳gripe lashing 缚带系绳-
gripe band 固定索gripe iron 马蹄形铁构件-
belt fastener 皮带连接器belt gripe 兜底索belt gripe 艇系紧带

entry.def: If you say that someone is griping, you mean they are annoying you because they keep on complaining about something.

example.ex: Why are football players griping when the average salary is half a million dollars?...
example.tran: 足球运动员的平均薪水已达50万美金，他们为什么还要抱怨呢？

example.ex: They were always griping about high prices.
example.tran: 他们总是抱怨物价太高。

entry.def: A gripe is a complaint about something.

example.ex: My only gripe is that one main course and one dessert were unavailable.
example.tran: 我唯一不满的就是连一道主菜和一份甜点都没有。

auth_sentence.content: Employees have often griped about the lack of leeway.
auth_sentence.res_content: Employees have often griped about the lack of leeway.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Employees have often griped about the lack of leeway.

auth_sentence.content: Cain griped about the movies his entire life.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cain griped about the movies his entire life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cain griped about the movies his entire life.

auth_sentence.content: Toyota is selling it at a loss, Detroit griped.
auth_sentence.res_content: Toyota is selling it at a loss, Detroit griped.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Toyota is selling it at a loss, Detroit griped.
